This sounds more complex then you are presenting it.It may appear like your boss is resistant to artificial intelligence. This sub will be quick to call him a Luddite. There is some truth to that.However, you referenced your job includes "regulatory documents." This suggests your job is significantly tied to interpreting and understanding legal language. If you get this wrong then that is an unbelievable risk to your company. Why would you get it wrong? Because we know AI hallucinates. It makes things up that aren't real. Imagine you wrote a document with regulatory guidance based on an interpretation of the law that isn't based in the actual language. We know AI does this.If you're using it to create visualizations, process data, or draft points based on outlines or notes... that's all fine. If you're using it to summarize legal documents, I would personally give you one warning to never do that again and if you kept doing it I would fire you.I may be reading too much into that one line in your post, but I'm going to assume your boss is generally a reasonable person which is why this disagreement is jarring. I think the concern is valid for that narrow use case. The rest of it should be fine.
